name: Smooth areas threshold
description:
This function finds smooth areas: regions of the image with low value of Beucher gradient (after Gaussian blur if requested). "Smooth areas" are the binary result of simple theshodling of the gradient by specified threshold. To remove little noise, this binary result can be also filtered by median with circle pattern.

If some mask binary image is specified, this function removes the "smooth areas" that are not connected with this mask. There is a very typical mask: 1-pixel boundary of the image, helping to find "exteral smooth background". This mask can be created and used automatically by the flag "Image border as mask".

in_ports.name: mask
in_ports.hint: If specified, retains in result only areas, intersected with this mask

controls.name: gaussianBlurKernelSize
controls.caption: Gaussian blur: kernel size
controls.description: If zero, blur is not performed
Level 1.0 means usual morphology (usual Beucher gradient), level < 1.0 means rank morphology (rank Beucher gradient).
controls.caption: Gradient Level
controls.name: gradientLevel

controls.caption: Diameter for median smoothing (0 to disable)
controls.name: medianDiameter

controls.description: Raw (not normalized) threshold value (0..255 for bytes, 0..65535 for 16-bit etc.)
controls.caption: Raw threshold
controls.name: rawValue

controls.description: Retain smooth areas touching the image border (if the mask image is not set)
controls.caption: Image border as mask
controls.name: borderAsDefaultMask

controls.description: Include the mask (if the mask image exists) or border (if the flag above is set) into resulting smooth area.
controls.caption: Include the mask into result
controls.name: includeMaskInRetained
